guideline_title: Dental interventions to prevent caries in children

recommendations.text: All children should brush their teeth or have their teeth brushed twice daily with a fluoride toothpaste.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade A recommendation based on systematic reviews and RCTs

recommendations.text: Children under 3 years of age should use a smear of toothpaste containing at least 1000 ppm fluoride.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade A recommendation based on systematic reviews and RCTs

recommendations.text: Children aged 3-6 years should use a pea-sized amount of toothpaste containing 1350-1500 ppm fluoride.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade A recommendation based on systematic reviews and RCTs

recommendations.text: Children should spit out excess toothpaste and not rinse with water after toothbrushing to maintain fluoride concentration in the mouth.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade B recommendation based on well-conducted studies

recommendations.text: All children should have fluoride varnish applied to their teeth at least twice yearly to prevent dental caries.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade A recommendation based on systematic reviews and RCTs

recommendations.text: Children at higher risk of developing dental caries may benefit from more frequent applications of fluoride varnish.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade B recommendation based on well-conducted studies

recommendations.text: Fissure sealants should be considered for all children on permanent molars as soon as possible after eruption.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade A recommendation based on systematic reviews and RCTs

recommendations.text: Resin-based fissure sealants should be used in preference to glass ionomer sealants on permanent teeth.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade B recommendation based on well-conducted studies

recommendations.text: Fissure sealants should be monitored regularly and repaired or replaced when necessary.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade C recommendation based on expert consensus

recommendations.text: Dietary advice should focus on reducing the frequency and amount of sugar consumption to prevent dental caries.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade B recommendation based on well-conducted studies

recommendations.text: Sugar-containing drinks should be limited and when consumed, should be consumed quickly and preferably through a straw.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade C recommendation based on expert consensus

recommendations.text: Parents and carers should be given consistent advice on preventing dental caries in children.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade C recommendation based on expert consensus

recommendations.text: Dental teams should provide anticipatory guidance to parents and carers about preventing dental caries.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade C recommendation based on expert consensus

recommendations.text: Children at increased risk of dental caries should be identified early and receive enhanced preventive care.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade C recommendation based on expert consensus

recommendations.text: Professional tooth cleaning should not be routinely recommended for preventing dental caries in children.
recommendations.reference: SIGN 138 - Grade B recommendation based on well-conducted studies
